ch.ecma.csta.callassociated

Interface CallAssociatedServices


  • public interface CallAssociatedServices
    CallAssociatedServices (non-Call Control related) features See the ECMA-269
    Since:
    20 Oct 2012
    Author:
    Avaya Inc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCallAssociatedListener(CallAssociatedListener listener, DeviceID devID) 
      CancelTelephonyTonesResponse cancelTelephonyTones(CancelTelephonyTones request)
      cancelTelephonyTones - supported in AES 6.3 Cancel a recording warning tone for the specified device.
      GenerateTelephonyTonesResponse generateTelephonyTones(GenerateTelephonyTones request)
      generateTelephonyTones - supported in AES 6.3 Generate a recording warning tone for every call in which the device is a party.
      void removeCallAssociatedListener(CallAssociatedListener listener) 

    • Method Detail

      • generateTelephonyTones

        GenerateTelephonyTonesResponse generateTelephonyTones(GenerateTelephonyTones request)
                                               throws CstaException
        generateTelephonyTones - supported in AES 6.3 Generate a recording warning tone for every call in which the device is a party. Note that the device must have been registered using the DMCC API and via the local AE Server.

        Parameters:
        request - A GenerateTelephonyTones request that contains a DeviceID of the device on which the warning tone is to be generated.
        Returns:
        A GenerateTelephonyTonesResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - Thrown if an invalid toneToSend or toneDuration has been specified.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid deviceID has been specified.
        InvalidDeviceStateException - Thrown if the device is not registered or was not registered via DMCC.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - Thrown if an implementation specific error occurred.

      • cancelTelephonyTones

        CancelTelephonyTonesResponse cancelTelephonyTones(CancelTelephonyTones request)
                                           throws CstaException
        cancelTelephonyTones - supported in AES 6.3 Cancel a recording warning tone for the specified device. Note that the device must have been registered using the DMCC API and via the local AE Server.

        Parameters:
        request - A CancelTelephonyTones request that contains a DeviceID of the device on which the warning tone is to be cancelled.
        Returns:
        A CancelTelephonyTonesResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionIDException - Thrown if an invalid connectionID has been specified.
        InvalidDeviceIDException - Thrown if an invalid deviceID has been specified.
        InvalidDeviceStateException - Thrown if the device is not registered or was not registered via DMCC.
        OperationException - Thrown if a logic error occurred in the code.
        CstaException - for any future exceptions.

      • addCallAssociatedListener

        void addCallAssociatedListener(CallAssociatedListener listener,
                               DeviceID devID)
                        throws CstaException
        Throws:
        CstaException

      • removeCallAssociatedListener

        void removeCallAssociatedListener(CallAssociatedListener listener)
                           throws CstaException
        Throws:
        CstaException
